pull.title: doc: Fix gen-manpages to check build options
pull.body:
Fixes https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/17506

gen-manapages.py should check enabled build options when generating docs

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--006a51241073e994b41acfe9ec718e94-->

ðŸš§ At least one of the CI tasks failed. Make sure to run all tests locally, according to the
documentation.

Possibly this is due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

<sub>Debug: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/21766942690</sub>
Probably should be a way to override this, in case someone actually wants a custom-fit manpage?

events.message: doc: Fix gen-manpages to check build options

events.body: @luke-jr you mean away to override the changes or the help2man generation?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +58,51 @@
     print('To properly generate man pages, please commit your changes (or discard them), rebuild, then run this script again.')
     print()
 
+
+def parse_and_remove_subsections_from_doc(document: str, subsections_to_remove: list[str]) -> str:
+    parsed_data = {}
+    parsed_data['HEADER'], *sections = document.split('.SH')
+    for section in sections:
+        section_header, *_ = section.split('\n')
+        section_header = section_header.strip()
+
+        if section_header == 'OPTIONS':
+            options_body = section.split('.HP')
+            for index, option in enumerate(options_body):
+                for subsection_to_remove in subsections_to_remove:
+                    if subsection_to_remove in option:
+                        del options_body[index]
+            parsed_data[section_header] = '.HP'.join(options_body)
+        else:
+            parsed_data[section_header] = section
+
+    return '.SH'.join([parsed_data['HEADER'], parsed_data['NAME'], parsed_data['SYNOPSIS'], parsed_data['DESCRIPTION'], parsed_data['OPTIONS'], parsed_data['COPYRIGHT']])
+
+
+def check_build_options(binary: str, document: str) -> str:
+    config = configparser.ConfigParser()
+    conffile = os.path.join(builddir, 'test/config.ini')
+    config.read(conffile)
+
+    docs_to_exlude = []
+    if (binary == 'bitcoind' or binary == 'bitcoin-qt') and not config['components'].getboolean('HAVE_SYSTEM'):
+        docs_to_exlude += ['shutdownnotify', 'alertnotify', 'startupnotify', 'blocknotify']
+        return parse_and_remove_subsections_from_doc(document, docs_to_exlude)
comments.body: My understanding would be that the check returns an error to recommend to build with the component, when a component is missing, no?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +58,35 @@
     print('To properly generate man pages, please commit your changes (or discard them), rebuild, then run this script again.')
     print()
 
+
+def check_build_options(binary: str, file: str) -> None:
+    config = configparser.ConfigParser()
+    conffile = os.path.join(builddir, 'test/config.ini')
+    config.read(conffile)
+
+    error_message = "Aborting generating {file}â€¦\nError: {component} support is not enabled.\nPlease enable it and try again."
+
+    if (binary == 'bitcoind' or binary == 'bitcoin-qt') and not config['components'].getboolean('HAVE_SYSTEM'):
+        print(error_message.format(component="System components", file=file))
+        sys.exit(1)
+
+    if (binary == 'bitcoind' or binary == 'bitcoin-qt') and not config['components'].getboolean('HAVE_SYSTEM'):
+        print(error_message.format(component="System components", file=file))
+        sys.exit(1)
+
+    if binary == 'bitcoin-wallet' and not config['components'].getboolean('ENABLE_WALLET'):
+        print(error_message.format(component="Wallet functionality", file=file))
+        sys.exit(1)
+
+    if (binary == 'bitcoind' or binary == 'bitcoin-qt') and not config['components'].getboolean('USE_UPNP'):
comments.body: what is the point of re-doing the check for every binary?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -57,6 +58,35 @@
     print('To properly generate man pages, please commit your changes (or discard them), rebuild, then run this script again.')
     print()
 
+

+    conffile = os.path.join(builddir, 'test/config.ini')

@@ -57,6 +58,30 @@
     print('To properly generate man pages, please commit your changes (or discard them), rebuild, then run this script again.')
     print()
 
+# Check enabled build options
+config = configparser.ConfigParser()
+conffile = os.path.join(builddir, 'test/config.ini')
+config.read(conffile)
+
+error_message = "Aborting generating manpagesâ€¦\nError: {component} support is not enabled.\nPlease enable it and try again."
+
+if not config['components'].getboolean('HAVE_SYSTEM'):
comments.body: This seems arbitrary and prone to breakage, giving the hardcoding of specific components. It also doesn't cover all of the relevant components in any case, i.e at least decl_fork and natpmp (which both effect manpage output) are missing any sort of check.

comments.body: Not sure. Although I think any changes here can wait until after CMake, as this script will likely need to be (partially) rewritten after that change in any case.

> changes here can wait until after CMake, as this script will likely need to be (partially) rewritten after that change in any case.

Can you explain this? config ini should be unrelated to the build system and shouldn't be affected by it.
